Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CHMEX i have been thinking lately of explorers and confs and rawconfs and dpowconfs. The situation is very very confusing, even as somebody who wrote dpowconfs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: or at least a big chunk of it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CHMEX let's say I make a transaction, and it has 2 raw confirmations, but no notarization

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: now I look at an explorer

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the explorer shows me 2 confirmations, because it uses rawconfs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but when I look at my exchange/app/etc, it shows me unconfirmed!!!

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: This has confused me before, so it definitely confuses end users and exchanges and people building apps on top of dpow coins

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CHMEX which is why I agree with you, that explorers should clarify rawconfs vs dpowconfs, until it's notarized, and then those concepts are the same

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it should show 1 confirm, not as unconfirmed

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
@dukeleto @CHMEX 
https://imgur.com/a/obtxoeQ
I've got the dPoW confs to display on insight exlorer, you can see the progression of a txn's state as blocks get added and notarizations happen from the images above 
right now:
```
daemon - explorer
confirmation - notary confirmation
rawconfirmation - confirmation
```
eventhough this system the daemon uses to convey the info is understandable by devs, to normal people it would be too confusing

So, the above thing is a proof of concept, I will be tweaking it to have only one conf tab. Its behaviour:
red - unconfirmed
orange with number of confs- confirmed but not dpowed
green with number of confs - dpowed
this should be clear to everyone

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content:
This may seem like a silly question but I honestly dont know the answer.
What if somebody tried to start an assetchain with the same name but different parameters as another assetchain already in existence?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @NutellaLicka i went down that rabbit hole a bit üòÖ

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: With Hush?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @NutellaLicka unless name + ac_supply are exactly the same, there will be different "magic" numbers and essentially they are different coins with the same name

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @NutellaLicka yeah, i tried to use HUSH as the AC name of HUSH v3

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but iguana knows Hush to be something very different

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and I was advised to use HUSH3

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @NutellaLicka it really only matters if both coins want to be dpowed with exactly the same asset name, then one basically needs to choose a new name

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if they don't want dpow, iguana doesn't know about it and it doesn't matter much. Until exchanges....
